title: Seventeenth century Japanese trade, foreign goods

content.question: The table best supports which of the following conclusions about Japanese trade in the seventeenth century?

choices.label: Chinese goods were becoming less desirable than Dutch goods.
Japanese imports of foreign goods were funded primarily by the export of precious metals.
Imports from China and Europe discouraged local production in Japan.
Chinese and Dutch imports accounted for only a small fraction of all imports to Japan.
Japanâ€™s ruling samurai elite became wealthy and powerful due to their control over local markets and merchants.

content.answer: Japanese imports of foreign goods were funded primarily by the export of precious metals.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
